parameters.name: O.Tenant
parameters.description:
Tenant is global namespace isolation for various objects. This can be automatically
filled in many cases based on the tenant a user, who created the object, belongs go.

parameters.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

parameters.description: Resource version in the object store. This can only be set by the server.

parameters.description: UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This can only be set by the server.

apiListMeta.description: ListMeta contains the metadata for list of objects.

Name.description: Name of the object, unique within a Namespace for scoped objects.

Tenant.description:
Tenant is global namespace isolation for various objects. This can be automatically
filled in many cases based on the tenant a user, who created the object, belongs go.

Namespace.description: Namespace of the object, for scoped objects.

ResourceVersion.description: Resource version in the object store. This can only be set by the server.

UUID.description: UUID is the unique identifier for the object. This can only be set by the server.

Labels.description: Labels are arbitrary (key,value) pairs associated with any object.

apiObjectMeta.description: ObjectMeta contains metadata that all objects stored in kvstore must have.

Kind.description: Kind represents the type of the API object.

APIVersion.description: APIVersion defines the version of the API object.

apiTypeMeta.description: TypeMeta contains the metadata about kind and version for all API objects.

cmdAutoMsgClusterWatchHelper.description:
Cluster represents a full cluster

Entity responsible & scenarios involved in managing this object:

     Create:
         o NetOps-admin
             - initial cluster creation
     Modify:
         o NetOps-admin
             - update spec attributes
         o CMD
             - update status attributes
     Delete:
         o NetOps-admin
             - TBD
cmdAutoMsgClusterWatchHelper.title: --------------------------------- CLUSTER ---------------------------------------------

Type.description:
QuorumNodes contains the list of hostnames for nodes configured to be quorum
nodes in the cluster.

Object.description:
VirtualIP is the IP address for managing the cluster. It will be hosted by
the winner of election between quorum nodes.

cmdAutoMsgNodeWatchHelper.description: ClusterSpec contains the configuration of the cluster.

Type.description: Leader contains the node name of the cluster leader.

cmdAutoMsgSmartNICWatchHelper.description: ClusterStatus contains the current state of the Cluster.

Spec.description: Spec contains the configuration of the node.

Status.description: Status contains the current state of the node.

cmdCluster.description:
Node is representation of a single node in the system.

Entity responsible & scenarios involved in managing this object:

     Create:
         o NetOps-admin
             - initial node creation for Baremetal node
         o CMD
             - auto created when Hypervisor Node and NIC are
               discovered via Orchestrator interface, NIC registration
     Modify:
         o NetOps-admin
             - update spec for Baremetal node
         o CMD
             - update spec attributes for Hypervisor node
             - update status attributes
     Delete:
         o NetOps-admin
             - when Baremetal node is decommissioned
         o CMD
             - TBD
cmdCluster.title: ---------------------------------- NODE -------------------------------------------

T.description: Roles is of list of roles a node can be configured with.

cmdClusterList.description: NodeSpec contains the configuration of the node.

QuorumNodes.description: Current lifecycle phase of the node.

NTPServers.title:
Nics holds a list of Mac addresses each uniquely identifying
a SmartNIC subsystem that is part of the Node

cmdClusterSpec.description: NodeStatus contains the current state of the node.

Leader.title: Type indicates a certain node condition

cmdClusterStatus.description: NodeCondition describes the state of a Node at a certain point.

O.title: Object name is Serial-Number of the SmartNIC

Spec.description: SmartNICSpec contains the configuration of the network adapter.

Status.description: SmartNICStatus contains the current state of the network adapter.

cmdNode.description:
SmartNIC represents the Naples I/O subsystem

Entity responsible & scenarios involved in managing this object:

     Create:
         o CMD
             - created as part of NIC registration, Admittance
     Modify:
         o CMD
             - update spec attributes
             - update status attributes
     Delete:
         o CMD
             - aging out stale or rejected NICs (TBD)
         o NetOps, SecOps
             - Decomission a NIC (TBD)
cmdNode.title: ------------------------------------ SMART NIC  -------------------------------------------

Type.title: Ports holds a list of Port Specs

cmdNodeCondition.title: SmartNICSpec contains configuration of the SmartNIC (Naples I/O subsystem)

cmdNodeConditionType.title: These are valid conditions of a Node

T.description: Current lifecycle phase of the SmartNIC.

cmdNodeList.title: SmartNICStatus contains current status of a SmartNIC

cmdNodePhase.title: Various phases in lifecycle of a Node

Roles.title: Type indicates a certain NIC condition

cmdNodeSpec.description: SmartNICCondition describes the state of a SmartNIC at a certain point.

Phase.title: Mac address of the Port, which is key identifier of the port

cmdNodeStatus.title: PortSpec contains configuration of a port in SmartNIC

Type.title: Mac address of the Port, which is key identifier of the port

cmdPortCondition.title: PortStatus contains current status of a Port

cmdPortConditionType.title: These are valid conditions of a Port

MacAddress.title: Type indicates a certain Port condition

cmdPortSpec.description: PortCondition describes the state of a Port at a certain point.

cmdSmartNICConditionType.title: These are valid conditions of a SmartNIC

cmdSmartNICPhase.title: Various phases in lifecycle of a SmartNIC
